etymology.description: 电话 + 号码 = number used for calling.
etymology.interpretation: Combines 'telephone' with 'number' to denote the numeric identifier for a phone line. Common in contexts of asking for, giving, or dialing contact details.
etymology.simplification: All components were simplified to reduce strokes: 電→电 (streamlined lightning/electricity graph), 話→话 (speech radical simplified to 讠), 號→号 (component merger and stroke reduction), 碼→码 (right component 馬→马; overall fewer strokes). These follow mid-20th-century PRC character simplification for efficiency.

parts.english: number; day of month; mark; sign

examples.chinese: 你的电话号码是多少(你的電話號碼是多少)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ de diànhuà hàomǎ shì duōshǎo.

examples.chinese: 请把你的电话号码写在这里(請把你的電話號碼寫在這裡)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ nǐ de diànhuà hàomǎ xiě zài zhèlǐ.
examples.english: Please write your phone number here.

examples.chinese: 拨打这个电话号码(撥打這個電話號碼)，就能联系客户服务(就能聯繫客戶服務)。
examples.pinyin: Bōdǎ zhège diànhuà hàomǎ, jiù néng liánxì kèhù fúwù.
examples.english: Call this phone number to reach customer service.
